intro: Palicourea beltraniana, commonly known as the Beltrán's palicourea, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in the understory of tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
